title: Chipotle Sage Sauce
ingredients: ⅔ cup thinly sliced white part of green onions
1 tablespoon minced fresh sage leaves or 1 teaspoon crumbled dried
1 large garlic clove, minced and mashed to a paste
instructions: In a saucepan cover the chipotles with water and bring the water to a boil, then simmer the chilies for 15 minutes or until they are tender.  Transfer the chipotles to a blender, add some of the water, and blend them until you have a consistency of tomato paste.  In another saucepan melt the butter over moderately high heat and add 2 tablespoons of the purée.  (Reserve any unused chipotle purée for another use in a closed container in the freezer.)  Also add the green onions, the sage, and the garlic and cook the mixture, stirring, for 5 minutes.  Add the wine and simmer the sauce, stirring occasionally, until the sauce is reduced to about one cup.
Source:  Chilies by Barbara Karoff, Gourmet Magazine, October 1989.
